body:
Comment 2: 
At the moment, godoc works as follows:

If a type has a comment immediately before it, that comment takes precedence, otherwise
the type group comment is used, if any.

I agree that sometimes one would like to see both comments (e.g., the group comment
could be in parens and smaller, as a reminder that this type belongs to a group of
types). This would not be very hard to do.

That said, the current approach is "as intended" originally, and not a bug. Please file
a feature request if you'd like to see a change here.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
